AdditionalInfo.OtherInfo: 1. Annual financial statements were used as source.
2. Amounts translated to stated functional currency of Barloworld Limited, ZAR, at relevant average exchange rates:
USD/ZAR 14,3332 (SEPT 2019)
GBP/ZAR 18,2884 (SEPT 2019)
BWP/ZAR 1,3714 (SEPT 2019)
AOA/ZAR 0,0455 (DEC 2018)
MZN/ZAR 0,2455 (SEPT 2019)
RUB/ZAR 0,2065 (DEC 2018)
ZMW/ZAR 1,1574 (SEPT 2019)
AED/ZAR 4,1288 (SEPT 2019)
GHS/ZAR 2,8129 (SEPT 2019)
TZS/ZAR 0,0066 (SEPT 2019)

3. Reporting fiscal year: 1 October 2018 - 30 Sept 2019. For CEs having a different financial year to reporting fiscal year, financial information was obtained for the 12 months period ending before 30 Sept 2019.
4. Haiden Investments (Pty) Ltd - instituted MAP - tax residency btw South Africa and Botswana.

5. Zeda Swaziland (Pty) Ltd became South African tax resident effective 1 Oct 2016 due to its poem being located in South Africa based on revised interpretation of poem by SARS. SA tax reference number (9360963186) no tax payable in South Africa as a result of foreign tax credits in respect of taxes paid in Swaziland.

6. Barloworld Equipment Swaziland (Pty) Ltd and Hillman Bros (Swaziland) (Pty) Ltd became South Africa tax resident effective 1 Oct 2016 due to their POEM being located in South Africa based on the revised interpretation of POEM by SARS. Obtained a SA tax reference number and paid tax in South Africa after foreign tax credits in respect of taxes paid in Swaziland were taken into account (Barloworld Equipment Swaziland (Pty) Ltd - 9275512227, income tax paid:R5 546.15 and Hillman Bros (Swaziland) (Pty) Ltd - 9926444168, income tax paid:R40.96) These entities were reflected as part of the Swaziland CbC only.
7. Tangible assets included Inventory, PPE and Rental Fleet.
8. Accumulated earnings include negative figures for Ghana, Lesotho, Tanzania, Zambia, South Africa, the UK, Russia, Botswana, USA, Dubai and Mozambique.

9. Barloworld Equipment Lesotho (Pty) Ltd became South Africa tax resident effective 1 October 2018 due to their POEM being located in South Africa based on the revised interpretation of POEM by SARS. MAP was instituted and the competent authorities of Lesotho and South Africa could not come to an agreement resulting in the taxpayer being dual resident. It obtained a SA tax reference and paid tax in South Africa after foreign tax credits in respect of taxes paid in Lesotho were taken into account. SA tax reference number: 9379478192, income tax paid: R1 674 592.
10. UK entities form part of UK tax group and only tax paid by reporting entity of UK tax group is reflected. Therefore in some instances a tax credit is reflected as part of income tax accrued.
11. Zimbabwe branch of Volumax (Pty) Ltd is in the business of supply chain management and is not asset intensive.
12. Uganda branch of Barloworld Logistics LLC has been deregistered in 2020.
13. Effective tax rate in the UK is affected by inter alia exempt dividends received.

14. Related party revenue would in respect of certain CEs have included amounts received from associates/joint ventures that were not CEs as part of this cbc report since reliance were placed on financial statements as source of what constitute related/unrelated party revenue.
15. Amounts excluded from accumulated earnings included non-distributable reserves, translation reserves, equity loans and revaluations reserves.

16. Barloworld Insurance Limited is Barloworld Group's captive insurance company incorporated in Ilse of Man and has appointed an independent insurance manager to run the day-to-day operations of BIL, hence no employees. BIL's income is imputed into South Africa, on which tax is paid at 28%, as BIL is a cfc of Barloworld Limited. The increase in PBT compared to 2018 was as a result of inter alia a reduction in claims paid, i.e. GBP 210 000 in 2019 versus GBP 1 147 000 in 2018.
17. A reason the tax paid in Lesotho is more in 2018 compared to 2019, includes an overpayment of tax in 2018.
18. Barloworld Logistics LLC was sold to a 3rd party, effective 1 October 2019.

19. Barloworld Jersey Limited is employment company for expatriates into Africa within Group, hence only related party income received. Also a cfc of Barloworld Investments (Pty) Ltd. The unrelated income received in 2018 was interest from the bank on a deposit.

20. Revenue calculated using income items in Income Statement;net amount reflected, actual income portion thereof was reflected if included as part of financials. Reliance was also place on items that was specfically reflected as part of the notes which had to be seperately reflected for accounting purposes, e.g. profit on disposal of PPE, reversal of a provision etc. Income items typically included revenue, finance income, profit on disposals, other income, realised exchange gains all as part of the Income Statement on the annual financial statements.
21. Revenue included accounting income items like an over provision for fees in the prior year, reversal of an impairment loss, fair value adjustments and loan write offs.
22. Barloworld UK Limited and Treasury division of Barloworld South Africa (Pty) Ltd provide treasury functions for the Barloworld Group.
23. Barloworld Pension Trust Limited is registered as a pension scheme with the HMRC and is exempt from tax.
24. The Russia business delivered a very good operating performance in repsect of its 2018 financial year, which led to an increase in revenue and pbt compared to its 2017 financial year.
25. Dividends received included as part of pbt. Dividends were received, and therefore included as part of pbt in the following countries: South Africa, the UK, Namibia and Botswana.
26. Share capital in Ghana includes GHS 2 460 264 of Amalgamated Fleet Services Ghana Limited, a dormant entity.

27. Due to the difficult trading conditions in Zimbabwe, e.g. the introduction of the RTGS dollar as local currency and economic pressures, the transportation requirements from Volumax's only customer (PPC Zimbabwe) reduced significantly, which resulted in the reduction of revenue.

28. The loss before tax reflected for Botswana can be ascribed to the significant trading loss recorded by Barloworld Equipment Botswana (Pty) Ltd in 2019 caused by adverse trading conditions. Retrenchment processes were instituted which resulted in the decrease in number of employees.
29. The USA entities are in the process of deregistration.
30. The Tanzania compnay is in the process of closing down. It is still subject to paying tax in terms of the alternative minmum tax regime.

31. The Malawi related party revenue reflected in 2019 relates to support fees payable by other Barloworld group companies for Caterpillar equipment sold in the Malawi territory, as per the CAT dealer agreement.

32. Some companies' AFS were not signed yet at the time of submission of the report and the report is therefore based on draft AFS. No significant differences are expected between the draft AFS and the final AFS.
33. Barloworld Equipamentos Mozambique Limitada delivered a very good operating performance, which led to an the increase in revenue and pbt compared to 2018.
34. Barloworld Agricultura Mozambique Lda has ceased trading and was deregistered in 2020.

35. Zeda Namibia (Pty) Ltd housed both the Avis Fleet and Avis Budget Rent a Car businesses until 31 May 2019. Effective 1 June 2019, only the Avis Fleet business forms part of Zeda Namibia (Pty) Ltd, with the Avis Budget Rent a Car business being housed in a new company, i.e. Zeda Car Rental (Namibia) (Pty) Ltd t/a Avis Budget Rent a Car Namibia.

36. During 2019, Barloworld concluded a Broad-Based Black Economic Empowerment (B-BBEE) which includes its staff, communities and the broader black public as participants. The B-BBEE transaction in short involved the disposal of all the properties owned and used by the Barloworld Group, to an empowered property company called Khula Sizwe Property Holdings (RF) Ltd, which in turn is owned by employees and managers of the Barloworld Group and the black public.
37. The change in pbt in respect of Namiba was inter alia as a result of the difficult trading conditions experienced by Equipment Namibia in 2019.

38. The related party revenue in respect of Angola in the 2018 report arose due to a machine sale to South Africa because it could not be sold in Angola. This was an exceptional scenario and hence no related party revenue reflected as part of the 2019 report.
